[ ] Provide the final answer in the required format The patient exhibits a combination of neurological phenotypes including: - Ventriculomegaly (brain ventricle enlargement) - Ataxia (movement coordination issues) - Congenital stationary night blindness - Optic disc drusen - Lethargy - Growth delay Among the candidate genes, TBCE is associated with "Encephalopathy, progressive, with amyotrophy and optic atrophy" which matches the patient's clinical presentation: - Progressive encephalopathy can explain ventriculomegaly and brain dysfunction - Amyotrophy can contribute to movement issues and ataxia - Optic atrophy explains the optic disc drusen and night blindness <solution> {'causal_gene': ['ENSG00000284770']} </solution>
